name: Classic Kanjivaram Silk
description: A timeless Kanjivaram silk saree with traditional peacock motifs and a rich zari border, perfect for weddings and grand occasions.

name: Elegant Banarasi Georgette
description: Lightweight Banarasi georgette saree with intricate floral jaal work. A blend of tradition and modern elegance.

name: Royal Paithani Weave
description: An exquisite handwoven Paithani saree from Maharashtra, featuring the iconic peacock pallu and vibrant colors.

name: Chanderi Cotton Silk
description: A graceful Chanderi cotton silk saree known for its sheer texture, light weight, and glossy finish. Ideal for summer festivities.

name: Mysore Silk Splendor
description: Lustrous Mysore silk saree with a minimalist design and a solid gold zari border, representing understated luxury.

name: Vibrant Bandhani Georgette
description: A lively Bandhani saree from Gujarat, featuring traditional tie-and-dye patterns on a flowing georgette fabric.

name: Orissa Ikat Handloom
description: Authentic single Ikat handloom saree from Odisha with blurred geometric patterns, a testament to skilled craftsmanship.

name: Lucknowi Chikankari
description: Delicate and artfully done Chikankari embroidery on a pastel-colored fabric, exuding grace and sophistication.

name: Patola Silk Replica
description: A beautiful power-loom version of the royal Patola silk saree, featuring intricate geometric designs and vibrant hues.

name: Kasavu Saree from Kerala
description: The traditional off-white and gold Kasavu saree, celebrated for its simplicity, elegance, and cultural significance.

name: Tussar Silk Elegance
description: A rich Tussar silk saree with a natural golden sheen and a slightly coarse texture, often adorned with tribal prints.

name: Jamdani Weave from Bengal
description: An airy and translucent Jamdani saree, handwoven with intricate motifs that appear to float on the surface.

name: Pochampally Ikat Silk
description: Stunning Pochampally Ikat from Telangana with bold, geometric patterns created by the intricate resist-dyeing technique.

name: Konrad Temple Saree
description: A traditional Konrad saree with wide borders featuring temple, peacock, or elephant motifs, originally woven for temple deities.

name: Soft Linen Saree
description: Breathable and comfortable linen saree with a subtle texture and simple design, perfect for professional or casual wear.

name: Gota Patti Work Saree
description: A festive Rajasthani saree embellished with Gota Patti applique work, adding a touch of shimmer and royalty.

name: Kalamkari Printed Cotton
description: An artistic cotton saree featuring hand-painted or block-printed Kalamkari designs depicting mythological tales.

name: Bhagalpuri Silk Saree
description: Also known as 'dull silk', this saree from Bhagalpur is known for its unique texture and affordability.

name: Leheriya Georgette
description: A vibrant saree with a distinctive wave-like pattern (Leheriya), a traditional tie-dye art from Rajasthan.

name: Tanchoi Silk Saree
description: A complex and intricate weaving style where the fabric has a satin finish and detailed, colorful motifs.

name: Muga Silk from Assam
description: One of the rarest silks in the world, Muga silk is known for its natural golden hue and extreme durability.

name: Phulkari Embroidered Saree
description: A stunning saree with Phulkari embroidery from Punjab, characterized by its vibrant, dense floral patterns.

name: Uppada Silk Saree
description: A lightweight and soft silk saree from Uppada, known for its intricate Jamdani weaving patterns.

name: Narayanpet Cotton Saree
description: A classic handloom cotton saree with a contrasting silk border and a unique pattu design on the pallu.

name: Baluchari Silk Saree
description: A rich silk saree from Bengal with pallus depicting stories from Indian mythology, woven with silk threads.

name: Maheshwari Silk Cotton
description: Originating from Maheshwar, this saree is famed for its reversible border and lightweight feel.

name: Ilkal Saree with Kasuti
description: Traditional Ilkal saree from Karnataka, known for its unique weaving technique that joins the body and pallu.

name: Chettinad Cotton Saree
description: A vibrant and bold cotton saree from Tamil Nadu, characterized by its heavy fabric and striking color contrasts.

name: Kosa Silk Saree
description: A type of Tussar silk from Chhattisgarh, Kosa silk is prized for its dull golden-brownish texture.

name: Mangalagiri Cotton
description: Durable Mangalagiri cotton saree from Andhra Pradesh with a simple design and a characteristic zari border.

name: Bomkai Saree 'Sonepuri'
description: A handloom saree from Odisha with Ikat and detailed threadwork embroidery on the pallu and border.

name: Digital Print Organza
description: A modern, lightweight organza saree with vibrant and artistic digital prints, perfect for parties.

name: Gadwal Silk Cotton
description: A unique saree where the body is cotton and the border and pallu are silk, woven separately and then joined.

name: Kota Doria Saree
description: A lightweight, airy saree from Rajasthan with a unique square-check pattern (khats) made of cotton and silk.

name: Venkatagiri Cotton Saree
description: A fine cotton saree from Andhra Pradesh, known for its Jamdani style weaving and delicate motifs.

name: Kantha Stitch Silk
description: A beautiful silk saree adorned with Kantha embroidery, a running stitch technique from West Bengal.

name: Dharmavaram Silk Saree
description: Heavy silk saree from Andhra Pradesh, known for its gold-plated zari borders and traditional motifs.

name: Ajrakh Printed Modal Silk
description: A soft modal silk saree featuring traditional Ajrakh block prints with natural dyes and intricate patterns.

name: Sambalpuri Bandha Saree
description: A traditional handwoven Ikat saree where the warp and weft are tie-dyed before weaving, from Sambalpur, Odisha.

name: Chiffon Saree with Sequin
description: A lightweight and flowing chiffon saree, embellished with delicate sequin work for a touch of sparkle.

name: Matka Silk Saree
description: A coarse-textured silk saree made from the waste of Mulberry silk, giving it a unique, rustic charm.

name: Crepe Silk Saree
description: A graceful and crinkled crepe silk saree that drapes beautifully, often featuring vibrant prints.

name: Raw Silk Saree
description: A crisp raw silk saree with a slightly textured feel, known for its natural look and elegant fall.

name: Satin Georgette Saree
description: A luxurious saree with the smoothness of satin and the flowy nature of georgette, perfect for evening events.

name: Tissue Silk Saree
description: A delicate and shimmering saree woven with fine silk and metallic threads, creating a tissue-like texture.

name: Hand-Blocked Bagru Print
description: A cotton saree from Bagru, Rajasthan, featuring traditional hand-block printing with natural dyes.

name: Coimbatore Cotton Silk
description: A soft and durable saree from Coimbatore, blending the comfort of cotton with the sheen of silk.

name: Bengal Tant Cotton
description: The quintessential Bengali cotton saree, known for its lightness, crispness, and decorative borders.

name: Chikankari on Kota Doria
description: A beautiful fusion of Lucknow's Chikankari embroidery on the checkered Kota Doria fabric.

name: Kanchi Cotton Saree
description: Durable and elegant Kanchi cotton saree with temple borders and traditional checks or stripes.
